intro: Scleria induta, commonly known as the velvetleaf sedges, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and spike-like inflorescences. Scleria induta typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, thriving in moist soils. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and wetland conservation efforts.
